availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel Henry Graves (Mercer County farmer, constable)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer and constable. Kentucky native. Married to Margrett Graves. Father of Joseph M. Graves, Jacob H. Graves, Mary E. Graves, Nancy J. Graves, William Y. Graves, and Hannah H. Graves. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860. Constable in Mercer County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 588
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Mercer County, KY, June-July 1863, p. 29, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Kentucky County, District and Probate Courts Mercer County, Will Books, 1865-1916 (1899), p. 118-119.
